Your code has too much double quotes. Additionally with a isSendMail: false you'll never receive an e-mail. The following code works fine for me and I receive an e-mail:

var user = Application.getUserInfo().id;
Application.sendNotification(

		title: "Test",

		isSendEmail: true,
		mode: ApplicationMode.Present,
		receivers: [user]
	}
);

entry.title: Re: Use of Business Area in Enterprise Architecture
entry.content:
Hello,

Your approach is correct. Business area is no longer a recommended field, and hasn't been for a long time. I've even had SAP consulting confirm this on a previous cleint project to re-assure the client.

The best design in both ECC and S/4HANA is to use profit center to recognise 'area of responsibility' which often relates to a certain level of product or brand and potentially geography too. 

And yes, traditional GUI reports are not exactly great in terms of profit center group support.

I think the way most organisations get around this in ECC is:

- I believe you can save variants in standard trial balance with a list of profit centers (I can't remember, please check).
- Use report painter/writer
- Z-reports as variations of standard one (not that hard to develop)
- Download various runs of standard reports and combine in excel (not ideal I know)
- Use BW

If you are in S/4HANA you have extra options with Fiori and embedded analytics
- Try 'trial balance' app
- Or try the query browser in embedded analytics (something like I_ProfitCenterHierarchyNode)

Lot's of options to investigate. 
But just to confirm, if you have people responsible for profit for areas of geography the profit center is the right approach.

I highly recommend sticking to standard use of organisation elements for future proofing. Do not use segment for area of responsibility. Only use it for IFRS segment. Anyway without custom developments it's only derived from profit center.

Let me know what you decide after investigating the various options.

entry.title: Re: Unable to determine function module by OPEN_FI from ETC 00003010
entry.content:
This error typically means that SAP couldn‚Äôt find a function module linked to a Business Transaction Event (BTE) during output processing in VF03. It‚Äôs often triggered when the output type is configured for EDI or similar formats, but the system lacks the necessary function module assignment for the BTE involved.

Where you can check this issue is go to FIBF, Check the event 00003010 under ‚ÄúEnvironment > Info System > BTEs‚Äù, Ensure a function module is assigned to this event. If not, this should be the root cause
Make sure, the Partner Profile for EDI is properly configured in we20.
Needless to mention, if other billing types are working fine and no issue, then, it could be data issue and not configuration

entry.title: Benefits (Insurance Plan) Configuration - SuccessFactors Employee Central Global Benefits
entry.content:
Benefits (Insurance Plan) ‚Äì Configuration 

To create Benefit Insurance, the following steps to be implemented

Step1: Create Insurance Provider ‚Äì Insurance provider is basically a service provider who provides insurance services to corporates

Step2: Create Enrollee options ‚Äì Multiple enrollee options can be created for an employee

Step3: Pay Components (if payroll automation is enabled) ‚Äì To be tagged at Insurance Level so that the deductions/contributions are maintained in the deduction statement

Step4: Rate Chart Rule for Contribution/Deductions ‚Äì Based on the enrollee options and other conditions contributions can be assigned

Step5: Insurance Rate Chart ‚Äì Define all the eligible enrollee options and respective structural attributes for automation of user interface

Step6: Insurance Plan ‚Äì Create an Insurance Plan and Tag the attributes created above

Step7: Legal Entity for Benefit ‚Äì Create a record to enable the benefit is applicable to respective legal entity users/Employees

Step8: Benefit Schedule Period ‚Äì Consists of Schedule

            Benefit Schedule ‚Äì consists of all dated related to Benefits enrollments and claims

Step9: Benefit ‚Äì Tag the relevant attributes that were created and complete the process

entry.title: Re: SAP HANA PARAMETERS TUNING FOR PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION
entry.content:
Hi Community,

"

  • Each Tenant DB can have different parameter values set, depending on each customer requirement
  • It is recommended that each Tenant has these best practice parameter values in place before productive use starts i.e. run these checks immediately after installation or upgrade, implement parameter value recommendations and test that these meet your business requirements
  • The output of the script will only show Hana parameters which are not currently set as per best practice recommendations
  • It will give recommended parameter value settings and note references on the particular parameter/topic area
  • In the P (Priority) column, you can see the most critical parameters to be set - 1 has highest priority
  • It will give actual SQL commands (ALTER statements) to set the parameter to the required value
  • And also an UNDO_COMMAND should you need to revert the parameter
  • If opening a support case with SAP Technical Support, providing the output of this parameter check will help to speed up the analysis"

Thanks for your selfless sharing, it really help us great  a lot.

 

üôÇ

 

Regards,

ZFiori.

entry.title: BILL OF MATERIALS (BOM)
entry.content:
BOM: - 

BOM -> Bill Of materials is a function which is widely used across many modules in sap. Modules namely Production planning (PP) will use mainly material Bom to get the finished product , Sales and distribution (SD) will also use material Bom but they will use the material Bom is and only if they are selling a component which is having multiple sub components for example computer and when it comes to Plant Maintenance (PM) there are 3 types of BOM namely Functional location Bom , Equipment Bom , Material Bom.

there is field BOM usage while creating BOM based on the requirement the usage key will changes for plant maintenance we will use key number 4 when it comes to production we will use 1 .  

                                                                 

                                                                                  

In each and every Bom one of the item screen will be present and  we can observe that there is item category , material number and quantity. we will maintain each of the fields.
In plant maintenance the below are the things that mostly will be maintained or mostly that are being used 

item category : -

 N -> Non stock item -> if we set the item category as non stock item (N) then a purchase requestion number will be raised from Bom and after the pr will be converted to PO and then Goods receipt in MIGO. Basically this will be done by persons who are responsible for Material Management(MM).

l -> Stock item -> if we set the item category as stock item then it means the stock is present in the inventory and it can be used.

R -> variable size item ->  if we set the item category as variable size item it means the materials size may vary depends upon the situation. Mostly this type of item category will be used by the automobile industries.                                                                                      

Quantity -> enter the number of quantity that is required.
Material number -> the materials which are required will be entered in this field.

Functional location Bom: - 

The functional location Bom refers to structured list of materials that are assigned to functional location. The components or materials which are added in the functional location Bom are required to maintain or to perform tasks for all the equipment's that are installed in the functional location.

Whenever a maintenance order or a work order is being created for the functional location for which Bom is created then these are the materials that are necessary for carrying out the maintenance activities.

To create a functional location Bom we can follow the path 

Sap easy access screen -> logistics -> plant maintenance -> maintenance of technical objects -> bill of material -> functional location Bom -> create
                                                                                        or 
                                                             We can also use the t-code : - IB11

here after entering into the functional location creation screen we will provide the functional location, Bom usage as '4' -> for plant maintenance.

then we will be navigated to the item screen in which the components are to be added.

Equipment Bom: - 

Equipment Bom refers to the materials that are required for maintaining of equipment. It defines all the spare parts, subassemblies, or tools that are required for maintaining or repairing that individual piece of equipment.

To create equipment Bom we will follow the path:
Sap easy access screen -> logistics -> plant maintenance -> maintenance of technical objects -> bill of material -> equipment Bom    -> create 
                                                                                                                     (or) 
                                                                                                            t-code : - IB01

Same here we will just provide the equipment plant and Bom usage in the next screen

we will provide the quantity material and item category too.

When a material in the BOM contains subcomponents, it indicates that additional materials are necessary then only we can use the main material. So then we will create as material Bom. Equipment Bom can also be created just to ensure that if any component that needs to damaged or it has to be replaced then they can also refer for BOM.

MATERIAL BOM: -

Material Bom is also a structured list but this Bom is mostly used by the production planning module because to get the raw materials as finished or semifinished product and it plays a vital role in other modules like SD ,MM, PM.

To create a material Bom we will follow the path :-
Sap easy access screen -> logistics -> plant maintenance -> maintenance of technical objects -> bill of material -> material bom -> create 
                                                                                                                 (or) 
                                                                                                      t-code : - CS01 

Here we will provide the material number , plant , Bom usage 

Then in the next screen we will maintain the items or materials whether they are stock item or non-stock item and its quantity.

After creating of material Bom for a material we can observe in equipment or functional location bom there is assembly checkbox beside PO quantity.

In each of the creation screen you can observe that there is change number it will be will be given when Engineering Change Management (ECM) is being implemented and it will collect all the information about all the details like who has changed the Bom, when they have changed etc... 

In conclusion we can say BOM - Bill of materials will play a vital role in SAP and can be used in various conditions.

Summary: - 

BOM will be used by across various modules - PP will use the material bom for the producing the finished goods, PM will use Equipment bom , Functional Bom , Material Bom too , MM will use the material bom to send the material to vendor in subcontracting process, SD will use it to sale the components to the customer etc.... 

BOMs help in planning, maintenance, procurement, and efficient execution of operations.

If any issues feel free to comment.

Regards ,
Neeraj.

entry.title: Re: Best Practice to Block a Plant in SAP
entry.content:
Deleting a plant from configuration is not recommended in a live system. It can Break historical reporting, Cause inconsistencies in transactional data & Impact audit trails

Some of the Best Practices to block a Plant are

  1. Ensure there are no open purchase orders, production orders, or stock in the plant. Archive or transfer data if needed before locking.
  2. Rename the plant to something like ‚ÄúDO NOT USE ‚Äì P002‚Äù to visually warn users.
  3. Use authorization object M_MSEG_WWA to restrict access to the plant for all users. Coordinate with your security team to remove the plant from user roles.
  4. In Material Master, use the MM/PP Status field in the MARC table to block production and procurement at the plant level. Set X-Plant Material Status to block sales, purchasing, or production globally
  5. In transaction OMWD, deactivate the valuation grouping code for P002. This prevents stock movements and invoice postings
  6. Go to transaction EC02 to remove the plant from organizational assignments (e.g., company code, purchasing org). Also check OX18 to remove plant-to-company code assignment

entry.title: Re: Exposing BAPI as OData API using RAP Facade
entry.content:
Hi @dz6 ,

The RAP framework does not allow any statement that would break the logical unit of work (LUW) during a save sequence, including the named statements.
This is not depending on the release but rather one of the following reasons:

  • The BAPI calls a customer BADI, which uses one of the forbidden statements
  • The BAPI calls a nested SAP feature that uses a forbidden statement ( really rare cases in old modules )

Please check the call stack in the short dump to locate the causing statement and from there check the call hierarchy backwards if it  is called by SAP or a customer exit.

If there is no customer code in the stack, please raise a support ticket, else contact the owner of the custom code / BADI implementation.

BR,

entry.title: Re: Handling Unit in packing process
entry.content:
Hi MMAR98,

I am not sure if I understand your scenario/process.

The delivery note works only for an outbound delivery. HU02 does not support the printing of the delivery note.

You have a sales order, then pack it in HUP32 and have a handling unit.
After that you can create an outbound delivery for the given sales order.
In the outbound delivery you can enter/assign the handling unit number from HUP32.
Then you should be able to print the delivery note with handling unit information.

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud ALM(Health Monitoring):Cartificates
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

 

Thanks for your patience.

We compared the screenshots provided under this case: The values(left days) of the certificates under Health Monitoring match with the "Valid to" date under Tr-Cd: STRUST.

Let me show you the details:

  • For CN=DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate, "Valid to" date is 2038/01/15,

and the date you confirmed from CALM is July 14th, there are 4501 days left from 2025/07/14 to 2038/01/15.

  • For CN=DigiCert Global Root CA certificate, "Valid to" date is 2031/11/10,

and the date you confirmed from CALM is July 14th, there are 2276 days left from 2025/07/14 to 2031/11/10.

  • For CN=DigiCert RSA4096 G5 certificate, "Valid to" date is 2046/01/14,

and the date you confirmed from CALM is July 14th, there are 7381 days left from 2025/07/14 to 2046/01/14.

 

Thus we know that The values(left days) of the certificates under Health Monitoring match with the "Valid to" date under Tr-Cd: STRUST.

Besides, the "certificates" metric value indicates the Number of days until the certificate expires. Default thresholds: 30 days: Warning / 7 days: Critical , thus you have no warns or critical alerts triggered for system DS4.

 

Please feel free to let me know when you have further inquiries.

 

Best Regards,

Sunny

entry.title: SAP Green Token H1-25 Updates & Highlights: Raising the Bar on Sustainability Compliance
entry.content:
As sustainability regulations tighten, and global supply chains grow more complex,  SAP Green Token   continues to deliver pragmatic solutions for chain-of-custody, compliance, and operational clarity. Our H1 2025 release focuses on deepening support for the EU Deforestation Regulation (EU

 

Making EUDR Work for Complex Supply Chains

##SAP Green Token delivers extended support for Article 9 of the EU Deforestation Regulation (EUDR), covering both operator and trader personas‚Äîfrom inbound geolocation capture to DDS number generation and outbound data transfers

We built these capabilities for enterprise complexity. Whether managing dozens of sites, importing from outside the EU, or reducing supplier risk, Green Token simplifies compliance and provides a future-ready foundation.

‚úÖ Highlights from the H1 release:

  • Operator & Trader support: DDS generation, handling EU and non-EU suppliers, TRACES integration
  • Transactional-level reporting: Built on ERP data, avoids duplication, reduces risk
  • Open API integrations: Import GeoJSON and DDS data from portals, GR processes, or external systems

Figure 1: All end-to-end scenarios covered in SAP Green Token in H1

üîÑ Supporting Article 9 Workflows for the EU and Beyond

Global supply chains rarely follow a single linear flow. Most large enterprises manage multiple flows in parallel‚Äîacross sites, regions, and regulatory jurisdictions. SAP Green Token is designed to handle exactly that.

We support inbound and outbound flow combinations under the EU Deforestation Regulation (EUDR) including movements between EU and non-EU regions and across internal company sites. This enables companies to track, validate, and document material origin and DDS data across their full supply network‚Äîregardless of geography or supply chain complexity.

üì• Built-In TRACES Integration
Green Token is directly connected to the EU TRACES system, enabling automated submission and tracking of DDS for both inbound and outbound shipments.

Based on your role (operator or trader), and the material flow direction, Green Token intelligently determines when to trigger TRACES submissions‚Äîminimizing errors, delays, and manual work. Simulation mode is also available for safe testing before go-live.

Why Transactional Reporting Matters

Most companies rely on annual reporting to track sustainability data‚Äîan approach still allowed under the EU Deforestation Regulation (EUDR). However, annual summaries can introduce risks, including outdated data, limited traceability, and delayed issue detection.

SAP Green Token offers an alternative: transactional-level reporting, seamlessly integrated with your ERP. This approach captures data per shipment, enabling real-time traceability, smarter DDS volume management, and proactive compliance.

‚úÖ Benefits:

  • More control: Filter by supplier, origin, or shipment quality
  • Risk isolation: One bad shipment won‚Äôt impact the entire batch
  • Smarter volume use: Avoid early DDS exhaustion
  • Lower long-term cost: Minimize corrections, fines, and rework

 

üéØ Our Focus: Article 9, Done Exceptionally Well

SAP Green Token is purpose-built to support Article 9 of the EU Deforestation Regulation (EUDR)‚Äîthe most operationally complex and compliance-critical part of the regulation. Our solution is designed to handle the transactional- and geolocation-level data management, organization, and submission required of operators and traders at scale.

Green Token provides deep SAP integration, automated DDS management, TRACES submission, and audit-ready traceability, all optimized for ERP-driven supply chains.

üß© We also leave white space for partners to extend the platform. For example, NTT Data independently built a supplier data management extension on top of Green Token for a customer‚Äîand we‚Äôre now exploring how to scale that model across the ecosystem.

This modular and integration-friendly approach enables customers and partners to build what's right for their workflows‚Äîwithout adding cost or complexity where it's not needed.

 

Enablement & Go-To-Market Assets: Everything You Need to Succeed

We released a full library of go-to-market and training assets to help teams implement Green Token.

Highlights include:

  • ISCC and EUDR demo systems
  • FAQs, L2 decks, pricing guides, onboarding content
  • Bi-monthly training sessions via Partner Portal
  • Integration & API guides

 

What‚Äôs Coming Next?

In H2 2025, we‚Äôre expanding into a completely new use case with support for the EU Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM), marking Green Token‚Äôs first step into carbon-related compliance. We‚Äôll also continue to strengthen our EUDR offering to support evolving regulatory and customer needs.

Curious how we‚Äôre tackling CBAM? Explore our first wave of materials here:

  • üìÑ The 6 things every CFO should do to prepare for CBAM ‚Äî Thought leadership article by Gunther Rothermel on CFO.com
  • üåê What is EU CBAM? ‚Äî A quick-read content hub that answers key questions and explains SAP‚Äôs role
  • üé• Watch now: CBAM Declarant Reporting with SAP Green Token ‚Äì our new video walkthrough of how the solution supports CBAM compliance 

 

Stay in Touch

We‚Äôre committed to delivering solutions that solve real problems‚Äîand we want to hear from you.

  • Submit feedback via the SAP Influence Portal
  • Request a demo via your SAP representative
  • Follow me on SAP Community

entry.title: Creating and testing a simple iFlow in SAP BTP Integration Suite
entry.content:
If you are just stepping into SAP BTP Integration Suite (Formerly known as CPI), this guide is for you. We will walk through creating a simple iFlow that- accepts HTTP request, logs the incoming messages, sends back a static response.

What is an iFlow ?

So let us understand first what is an iFlow and components of an iFlow.

An iFlow defines how data is moving from one system to another, it's like a visual blueprint where we can connect, transforms and routes messages between application.

Prerequisites:

  • SAP BTP Global account (link- https://account.hana.ondemand.com/#/home/welcome)

  • Access to SAP Integration Suite (formerly known as CPI)
  • We need "IntegrationDeveloper" and other roles as per our requirement.

Step-by-Step guide how to create an iFlow.

Step 1: Log in to SAP Integration Suite

  • Go to SAP BTP Cockpit
  • Navigate to your Subaccount > Instance and Subscription (Check if Integration suite is subscribed or not, if not then we have to subscribe)

  •  

Step 2: Create a New Integration Flow (iFlow)

  • Open Integration Suite (Click on Integration Suite)

  • Go to Design tab (1)

    Integration and APIs (2)

    Click on Create (3) (It will create a Package) 

    Package-- A package is a container where we can group together related integration artifacts to organize and manage them as a cohesive unit. Like- iFlows, value mapping, and scripts.
  • In Header part give - (Name>Technical name>Short Description) > Save

  • Go to Artifacts > Add > Select -Integration Flow.

  • Give Name > ID > Runtime Profile > Description > Click on Add

Now we successfully created an iFlow under the package "Simple_iFlow".

 

Step-3:  Design the iFlow

First click on the created iFlow---‚úîÔ∏è

  • We can see one Sender, one Receiver out of the box and inside the box Start and End message.

Start Event:         

  1. Click on Edit > Drag and drop a connection from 'Sender' to 'Start' message > choose 'HTTPS' 
  2.  Click on Connection and Configure:    Connection: 'Address'-- '/simpletest', 'Authorization:' 'User Role', 'User Role:' 'ESBMessaging.send'
  3. Click on Save.

  • Add a Content Modifier-- A content modifier enables users to modify message headers, properties, and payload. We can find it under Message Transformer option. Ôøº
  • Place the content modifier between 'Start' and 'End'. 

Configure ---- Message Body > Keep type as 'constant' and in Body we can give payload, as given in the screenshot (We can add any message as per wish in the Body section of the content modifier).

  • Click on Save.
  • Now we need a "Request Reply" to send the message to an external system (i.e Receiver) and we use it for getting a response from external system before proceeding. 
  • Go to Call > External Call > Select Request Reply

  • Now we will bring the Receiver below the Request Reply (Just for proper alignment) and we are making a connection with the Receiver using HTTP type.

From drop down expand the HTTP connection after selecting, and provide details like--- 

In Connection---

Address- (Provide the address from where we want to fetch the data)

Proxy Type- Internet,     Method- Post,    Authentication- None.

  • Now connect the End with Request Reply to complete the iFlow. The final iFlow looks like this--

Step-4: Save and deploy the iFlow

  • In the first step Save the created iFlow and click on Deploy button.

  • After clicking on the Deploy button we can see this option--
  • Click on Yes and then Ok we will get success message if the iFlow is successfully deployed.

  •  

     

Step-5: Testing the iFlow

We can test the iFlow in different ways, mainly we will test if we are getting the message which we are sending.

Open a new integration suite.

Go to Monitor> Integrations and APIs > Manage Integration Content (Click) 

Here we can find our deployed iFlow name and its status, deployment success message and the iFow end point which is very much important. We can change our log configuration from info to trace and re-deploy to check how much information is logged during the execution of an integration suite.

Copy the iFlow end point and now we will test in Postman. Before we proceed, we need to setup the postman and we have to create new request. Make the request as Post and paste the iFlow endpoint in the marked place.

Set Authorization as Basic Authentication, we have to give our logging credentials, like -username and password for authentication.

In Body select raw-Json data and give a message payload. The sample payload is-

{

    "message": "Test from Postman",

    "data": "Sample data"

}

Now we will send the request and if we get 200 OK success messages then the request is successful, and we are getting the message. 

Now go to the Integration Suite > Monitor > Integration and APIs > Monitor message processing--- here we can see 1 message as we send the POST request in Postman using the iFlow endpoint.

Open the Monitor Message Processing and we can find the status and processing time taken by the iFlow to execute and message processing completed successfully or not.

Now if we want to see the iFlows response directly we have to do little modifiction in the iFlow. 

  1. Edit the iFlow
  2. Remove the HTTP receiver connection
  3. Connect the content modifier directly to the end event.
  4. Save and deploy.

Now copy the iFlow end point and send the Post request in Postman, we will get the same format of payload which we gave in the content modifier body.

Conclusion:

Creating your first iFlow in SAP BTP Integration Suite might seem difficult initially, but as we can see it's straight forward once you understand the basics. This step-by-step guide covered all the essential concepts from package creation to testing and troubleshooting.

#SAPIntegrationSuite #SAPBTP #iFlow #CloudIntegration #SAP #API #Postman

Did the blog help you? Please like, share, and leave a comment with your thought and questions. Your feedback helps me create better content for the community!

entry.title: Re: Final settlement is not considering the previous sett...
entry.content:
You can correct the existing Settlement with the below approach

  • Option-1 - Create a Delta Settlement (Settlement Type = 2) for the affected condition contract. Manually adjust the settlement amount to reflect the previously settled value. Include the RES2 condition type manually in the pricing procedure if needed. This ensures the system doesn‚Äôt duplicate the payout and mimics what RES2 would have done automatically.
  • Option-2 - If feasible, reverse the final settlement document. Adjust the Bill-to Party in the settlement document to match the Sold-to Party from the business volume criteria. Re-run the final settlement so that RES2 is correctly triggered. This is only viable if the reversal won‚Äôt disrupt downstream processes like accounting or reporting.
  • Option-3 - If there is a need for bulk processing, then, Use BAPI_CONDITION_CONTRACT_SETTLEMENT, to read the historical settlement data, Calculate the correct RES2 amount, Post a manual correction document (e.g., credit memo or debit memo). This is ideal for bulk corrections across multiple contracts or partners.

entry.title: Transforming User Experience: SAP Fiori Launchpad adopts the latest SAP Design System
entry.content:
Overview

The SAP Fiori launchpad now incorporates the latest SAP Design System, bringing improvements to the shell bar and navigation area, user menu and notifications. These enhancements are designed to unify and streamline the user experience, ensuring the interface is more intuitive and consistent across SAP's portfolio, in alignment with our Suite First strategy.

 

Feature release outlook

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

This feature is available with 2508. Parts of it will be offered as opt-in (refer to the  SAP KBA and SAP Note).

For further information refer to the official documentation here.

  • SAP BTP ABAP Environment

This feature is available with 2508 (only when spaces and pages are enabled).

For further information refer to the official documentation here.

  • SAP Integrated Business Planning

This feature is available with 2508.

For further information refer to the official documentation here.

 

Key Highlights

Shell Bar 

A key update is the repositioning of the navigation menu. It is now prominently located at the top of the shell bar, enabling users to access the navigation menu swiftly and efficiently.

Before and After:

  • Before: The navigation menu was designed to support the personalization of spaces.
  • After: The functionality has been enhanced, and the navigation menu now offers seamless access to navigation.

Additionally, for SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud and SAP BTP ABAP environment the shell bar now supports displaying the product name alongside the company or brand logo. Administrators can manage and translate the product name using the WINDOW_TITLE_EXTENSION parameter located in the Manage Launchpad Settings app, e.g. refer to Manage Launchpad Settings | SAP Help Portal for SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud Edition.

Before and After:

  • Before: The product name could not be included in the shell bar.
  • After: The product name is now configurable and can be displayed in the shell bar next to the company or brand logo. Likewise, the browser window title, the product name next to the logo and the app title are now synchronized. 

                                                                                                   

 

Navigation menu

 

‚ÄÉ

The navigation can now be accessed using the navigation menu. If the My Home space is configured, you will see the Favorites Apps section .(For SAP S/4HANA My Home space is in sync with the Favorites). Following this, you'll find the My Spaces section. In this section, you can view all your personalized spaces and pages.

If the SPACES_NAVIGATION_BAR_PERSONALIZATION setting is enabled in the Manage Launchpad Settings app, you'll see the All Spaces option, which allows for personalization of spaces (pinning and unpinning spaces).

 Before and After:

  • Before: The navigation menu had a different position in the shell bar, providing options for personalizing spaces.
  • After: The most significant advantage of the navigation is that it allows you to directly access entries from within any application, eliminating the need to return to the home page first.

User Menu

The user menu has been updated from a simple popover with a list to a more visually appealing design. The entries have been reordered according to new UXC guidelines, placing ‚ÄòSettings‚Äô at the top. The menu now can display an avatar, user's ID or the e-mail address depending on configuration options in the different products or platforms. Previously, the sign-out option was a standard list item located at the end of the list. It has now been relocated to the footer of the user menu.

Before and After:

  • Before: The user menu previously was a basic list items menu.
  • After: The user menu has been redesigned to provide a more intuitive user experience.

Notifications

 

Earlier, notifications could be grouped by Date, Type, and Priority. Considering recent usage data that indicated minimal use of the "By Type" option, the UI has been simplified by eliminating this grouping. Notifications can now be sorted using a sort of button, with options to arrange them by date or by importance.

Moreover, while in the notifications view, users can easily navigate to notification settings in the user menu by using the Settings icon in the upper-right corner.

Before and After:

  • Before: Previously, notifications were grouped by Date, Type, or Priority.
  • After: Notifications are now organized by date or importance, with direct access to settings via the Settings  icon.

Conclusion

With the adoption of the latest SAP Design System we strive to empower users to navigate and use SAP applications with greater ease and efficiency.

entry.title: A cross application Fiori APP to print Adobe Forms
entry.content:
This Cross-Application Fiori APP allows to download any Output of Print forms in PDF format based on FDP (Form data provider interface). Just by choosing the application/document type (e.g. MM-Purchase Order, SD-Billing Document,..etc) and selecting the document criteria, it produces the list of documents with the downloadable PDF links. 

Note- I am very grateful to the author(Prabhjot Bhatia )  of the blog ABAP Programming Model for SAP Fiori ‚Äì 13 ‚Äì How to Preview and Download PDF in Fiori Apps |   , which provided me the tips on creating the downloadable PDF links.

Note- I have created 2 custom config tables to store some key name-value pairs(such as "sender country",..etc for Master and Content ADOBE Templates), which will be used in this APP.  I must confess that this is a limitation in this APP development as the better approach is to derive these keys value dynamically.

You can create this APP in your environment with the following steps.

Step 1 -  Create the following ABAP dictionary objects. Table 1 and 2 will be used as the configuration tables to retrieve key Name-Value pairs for Master and Content Adobe templates. 

Table 1 - ZDCP_FP_IT_M_KEY

Table 2 - ZDCP_FP_PDF_FORM

Assign the Table 1 in the foreign key relationship to the field IV_OBJECT_TYPE in Table 1.

Maintenance view ZDCP_FP_FORMS_MV, which combines the Table 1 and 2.

Sample data for table 1 and 2

Note - By debugging CL_APOC_OR_H_UTILITY->_RENDER_DOCUMENT_MULTI  in tcode mE22n, you can retrieve the standard name-value pairs such as RecieverpartnerNumber, sender countries,..etc. If you dig deeper, you could be able to retrieve these value dynamically based on document number(e.g. PO number) during runtime, instead of reading from configuration table.

 

Note- It is possible to add multiple ADOBE templates (both master and content) in the table ZDCP_FP_PDF_FORM. This allows to test multiple ADOBE layouts. In this sample data, Version 1 represent standard SAP ADOBE templates and Version 2 represent custom made templates.

 

 

 

 

Structure ZDCP_OBJECT_PDF_V2

 

 

Step 2 ‚Äì Create the following FM ZGENERATE_PDF_XSTRING and the subroutine

FUNCTION ZGENERATE_PDF_XSTRING.
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"*"Local Interface:
*"  IMPORTING
*"     REFERENCE(IV_OBJECT_TYPE) TYPE  STRING
*"     REFERENCE(IV_OBJECT_NR) TYPE  STRING
*"     REFERENCE(IV_VERSION_NR) TYPE  VERSNR_KK
*"     REFERENCE(IV_FYEAR) TYPE  /ACCGO/E_FISCAL_YEAR
*"     REFERENCE(IV_CC) TYPE  /ACCGO/E_COMPANYCODE_VH
*"  EXPORTING
*"     REFERENCE(EV_DOCUMENT_DATA) TYPE  XSTRING
*"     REFERENCE(EV_PAGES) TYPE  FPPAGECOUNT
*"     REFERENCE(EV_TRACE_STRING) TYPE  STRING
*"     REFERENCE(EV_STOP_PROCESSING) TYPE  ABAP_BOOL
*"     REFERENCE(EV_PDL_TYPE) TYPE  APOC_PDL_TYPE
*"     REFERENCE(ET_MESSAGE) TYPE  CL_SOMU_FORM_SERVICES=>TY_GT_MESSAGE
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
  TYPES:
    BEGIN OF ty_gs_fdp_key,
      name  TYPE string,
      value TYPE string,
    END OF ty_gs_fdp_key .
  TYPES:
    ty_gt_fdp_key TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_gs_fdp_key WITH EMPTY KEY .
  DATA wa_message TYPE LINE OF cl_somu_form_services=>ty_gt_message.
  DATA: it_master_keys    TYPE ty_gt_fdp_key .
  DATA: ls_master_keys    TYPE name2stringvalue_table, wa_ls_master_keys TYPE name2stringvalue.
*NAME2STRINGVALUE
  DATA lv_pq_name      TYPE pq_qname.
  DATA lv_xml_in       TYPE xstring.
  DATA lv_stop         TYPE boole_d.
  DATA: it_key          TYPE ty_gt_fdp_key, ls_appl_keys    TYPE name2stringvalue_table, wa_ls_appl_keys TYPE ty_gs_fdp_key.
  DATA lo_hlp          TYPE REF TO if_apoc_or_h_factory_internal.
  DATA lo_fp_srv       TYPE REF TO if_apoc_somu_form_services.
  DATA render_options TYPE cl_somu_form_services=>ty_gs_render_options.
  DATA ls_merge_doc    TYPE if_apoc_document_merge=>document_object.
  DATA lt_msg          TYPE cl_somu_form_services=>ty_gt_message.
  DATA lt_msg_all      TYPE cl_somu_form_services=>ty_gt_message.
  DATA lv_xml_out      TYPE xstring.
  DATA lv_pdl_type     TYPE apoc_pdl_type.
  DATA: pdf_form TYPE  fpwbformname VALUE 'ZZ1_DCP_MM_PUR_PURCHASE_ORDER', pdf_mfor TYPE apoc_form_master_template_id VALUE 'ZZ1_DCP_MM_PUR_ORDER_MASTER'  .
  DATA wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv TYPE zdcp_fp_forms_mv.
  PERFORM set_default_keys  USING iv_object_type iv_object_nr iv_version_nr CHANGING ls_master_keys ls_appl_keys pdf_form pdf_mfor.


* Object Type specific
  CASE iv_object_type.
    WHEN 'PURCHASE_ORDER'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'PurchaseOrder'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value =  iv_object_nr.
      APPEND wa_ls_appl_keys TO ls_appl_keys.

      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'PurchaseOrderChangeFlag'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value = ''.
    WHEN 'BILLING_DOCUMENT'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'BillingDocument'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value =  iv_object_nr.
  ENDCASE.

  APPEND wa_ls_appl_keys TO ls_appl_keys.
*Validate the Document
  CASE iv_object_type.
    WHEN 'PURCHASE_ORDER'.
      SELECT SINGLE ebeln FROM ekko INTO (lv_ebeln) WHERE ebeln = _object_nr.
      IF sy-subrc NE 0.
        wa_message-type = 'E'.
        CONCATENATE 'PO ' iv_object_nr ' does not exist.' INTO wa_message-text.
        APPEND wa_message TO et_message.
*        MESSAGE i899(/cdbasis/msg) WITH 'PO ' iv_object_nr ' does not exist.'.
*        LEAVE TO TRANSACTION 'Z_PO_ADOBE'.
      ENDIF.

    WHEN 'BILLING_DOCUMENT'.
      SELECT SINGLE vbeln FROM vbrk INTO (lv_vbeln) WHERE vbeln = _object_nr.
      IF sy-subrc NE 0.
        wa_message-type = 'E'.
        CONCATENATE 'Billing Document ' iv_object_nr ' does not exist.' INTO wa_message-text.
        APPEND wa_message TO et_message.
*        MESSAGE i899(/cdbasis/msg) WITH 'Billing Document ' iv_object_nr ' does not exist.'.
*        LEAVE TO TRANSACTION 'Z_PO_ADOBE'.

      ENDIF.

  ENDCASE.


  lo_hlp = cl_apoc_or_h_factory_internal=>get_helper_factory( ).


  TRY.
      " Get form provide services
      lo_fp_srv = lo_hlp->get_somu_form_services( ).

      TRY.
          it_master_keys = ls_master_keys.
          it_key = ls_appl_keys.
          lo_fp_srv->get_document(
            EXPORTING
*        iv_master_form_name     = 'ZZ1_DCP_MM_PUR_ORDER_MASTER'
              iv_master_form_name            = pdf_mfor
*        iv_form_name            = 'ZZ1_DCP_MM_PUR_PURCHASE_ORDER'
              iv_form_name            = pdf_form
              it_key                  = it_key
*        it_filter_select_option = ls_appl-filter_options
              it_master_key           = it_master_keys
              iv_form_language        = 'E'
              iv_form_country         = 'CA'
              is_render_options       = render_options
              iv_print_queue_name     = lv_pq_name
              iv_xml                  = lv_xml_in
              iv_disable_cache        = 'X'
            IMPORTING
              ev_content              = ev_document_data
              ev_pages                = ev_pages
              ev_stop_processing      = lv_stop
              et_message              = lt_msg
              ev_xml                  = lv_xml_out
              ev_pdl_type             = lv_pdl_type ).
          INSERT LINES OF lt_msg INTO TABLE lt_msg_all.

        CATCH cx_somu_error INTO DATA(error_somu).
          DATA(text_somu) = error_somu->get_text( ).
          wa_message-type = 'E'.
          wa_message-text = text_somu.
          APPEND wa_message TO et_message.
*          MESSAGE i899(/cdbasis/msg) WITH text_somu.
          sy-subrc = 98.
      ENDTRY.
    CATCH cx_apoc_extern_services INTO DATA(error_apoc_services).
      DATA(text_apoc) = error_apoc_services->get_text( ).
      wa_message-type = 'E'.
      wa_message-text = text_apoc.
      APPEND wa_message TO et_message.
*      MESSAGE i899(/cdbasis/msg) WITH text_apoc.
  ENDTRY.

ENDFUNCTION.
FORM set_default_keys USING iv_object_type iv_object_nr iv_version_nr  CHANGING ls_master_keys TYPE name2stringvalue_table ls_appl_keys TYPE name2stringvalue_table pdf_form pdf_mfor.
  DATA: wa_ls_master_keys   TYPE name2stringvalue, wa_ls_appl_keys TYPE name2stringvalue,
        wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv TYPE zdcp_fp_forms_mv.
  SELECT SINGLE * FROM zdcp_fp_pdf_form INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv
    WHERE iv_object_type = iv_object_type
      AND iv_version_nr  = iv_version_nr.
  SELECT SINGLE * FROM zdcp_fp_it_m_key INTO  CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv
WHERE iv_object_type = iv_object_type.


  wa_ls_master_keys-name = 'Recipient'.
  wa_ls_master_keys-value = wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv-name_par_04.
  APPEND wa_ls_master_keys TO ls_master_keys.
  wa_ls_master_keys-name = 'OutputRequestItem'.
  wa_ls_master_keys-value = wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv-name_par_05.
  APPEND wa_ls_master_keys TO ls_master_keys.
  wa_ls_master_keys-name = 'OutputControlApplicationObject'.
*wa_ls_master_keys-value = '4500000369'.
  wa_ls_master_keys-value = iv_object_nr.
  APPEND wa_ls_master_keys TO ls_master_keys.
  wa_ls_master_keys-name = 'WatermarkText'.
  wa_ls_master_keys-value = wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv-name_par_07.
  APPEND wa_ls_master_keys TO ls_master_keys.
  wa_ls_master_keys-name = 'LocaleCountry'.
  wa_ls_master_keys-value = wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv-name_par_08.
  APPEND wa_ls_master_keys TO ls_master_keys.
  wa_ls_master_keys-name = 'LocaleLanguage'.
  wa_ls_master_keys-value = wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv-name_par_09.
  APPEND wa_ls_master_keys TO ls_master_keys.
  wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'ReceiverPartnerNumber'.
  wa_ls_appl_keys-value = wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv-name_par_01.
  APPEND wa_ls_appl_keys TO ls_appl_keys.
  wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'SenderCountry'.
  wa_ls_appl_keys-value = wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv-name_par_02.
  APPEND wa_ls_appl_keys TO ls_appl_keys.
  wa_ls_master_keys-name = 'SenderCountry'.
  wa_ls_master_keys-value = wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv-name_par_02.
  APPEND wa_ls_master_keys TO ls_master_keys.
  wa_ls_master_keys-name = 'RecipientRole'.
  wa_ls_master_keys-value = wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv-name_par_10.
  APPEND wa_ls_master_keys TO ls_master_keys.
  wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'Language'.
  wa_ls_appl_keys-value = wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv-name_par_03.
  APPEND wa_ls_appl_keys TO ls_appl_keys.

  wa_ls_master_keys-name = 'PrintFormDerivationRule'.
  wa_ls_master_keys-value = wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv-name_par_11.
  APPEND wa_ls_master_keys TO ls_master_keys.
  wa_ls_master_keys-name = 'OutputControlApplicationObjectType'.
  wa_ls_master_keys-value = wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv-name_par_12.
  APPEND wa_ls_master_keys TO ls_master_keys.
  wa_ls_master_keys-name = 'OutputDocumentType'.
  wa_ls_master_keys-value = wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv-name_par_13.
  APPEND wa_ls_master_keys TO ls_master_keys.

*Document specific
  wa_ls_master_keys-name = 'OutputControlApplicationObject'.
  wa_ls_master_keys-value = iv_object_nr.
  APPEND wa_ls_master_keys TO ls_master_keys.

  pdf_form = wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv-content_form.
  pdf_mfor = wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv-master_form .
ENDFORM.

Note - In this FM, only the Application types PURCHASE_ORDER and BILLING_DOCUMENT are included. If you want to add additional Application types then add those type is the config tables 1 and 2 with appropriate values. Also add some additional code in the FM in the section "* Object Type specific".

Step 3 - Create a project in the tcode SEGW

Create the following entity get_pdf in this project using the structure ZDCP_OBJECT_PDF_V2.

Note- check on the field "Media author"

 

Generate the project and it will create the following classes.

Add the following code in the method /IWBEP/IF_MGW_APPL_SRV_RUNTIME~GET_STREAM

of the class ZCL_ZDCP_PDF_CROSS__01_DPC_EXT.

  METHOD /iwbep/if_mgw_appl_srv_runtime~get_stream.
**TRY.
*CALL METHOD SUPER->/IWBEP/IF_MGW_APPL_SRV_RUNTIME~GET_STREAM
**  EXPORTING
**    iv_entity_name          =
**    iv_entity_set_name      =
**    iv_source_name          =
**    it_key_tab              =
**    it_navigation_path      =
**    io_tech_request_context =
**  IMPORTING
**    er_stream               =
**    es_response_context     =
*    .
**  CATCH /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception.
**  CATCH /iwbep/cx_mgw_tech_exception.
**ENDTRY.
    DATA: ls_stream          TYPE ty_s_media_resource, wa_zdcp_object_pdf TYPE zdcp_object_pdf_v2,
          lw_key             TYPE  /iwbep/s_mgw_name_value_pair.
    DATA ls_merge_doc    TYPE if_apoc_document_merge=>document_object.
    READ TABLE it_key_tab INTO lw_key INDEX 1.
    wa_zdcp_object_pdf-iv_object_type = lw_key-value.
    READ TABLE it_key_tab INTO lw_key INDEX 2.
    wa_zdcp_object_pdf-iv_version_nr = lw_key-value.
    READ TABLE it_key_tab INTO lw_key INDEX 3.
    wa_zdcp_object_pdf-iv_object_nr = lw_key-value.
    READ TABLE it_key_tab INTO lw_key INDEX 4.
    wa_zdcp_object_pdf-iv_fyear = lw_key-value.
    READ TABLE it_key_tab INTO lw_key INDEX 5.
    wa_zdcp_object_pdf-iv_cc = lw_key-value.
    CALL FUNCTION 'ZGENERATE_PDF_XSTRING'
      EXPORTING
        iv_object_type   = wa_zdcp_object_pdf-iv_object_type
        iv_object_nr     = wa_zdcp_object_pdf-iv_object_nr
        iv_version_nr    = wa_zdcp_object_pdf-iv_version_nr
        iv_fyear         = wa_zdcp_object_pdf-iv_fyear
        iv_cc            = wa_zdcp_object_pdf-iv_cc
      IMPORTING
        ev_document_data = ls_merge_doc-document_data
*       EV_PAGES         =
*       EV_TRACE_STRING  =
*       EV_STOP_PROCESSING       =
*       EV_PDL_TYPE      =
*       ET_MESSAGE       =
      .

    ls_stream-value = ls_merge_doc-document_data.
    ls_stream-mime_type = TEXT-001. "application/pdf"
    copy_data_to_ref( EXPORTING is_data = ls_stream CHANGING cr_data = er_stream ).
  ENDMETHOD.

Step 4 - Create the following CDS View entity ZCDS_OBJECT_PDF_V3

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Object information for ADOBE PDF'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@OData.publish: true
   
define view entity ZCDS_OBJECT_PDF_V3

  with parameters
    @Consumption.defaultValue : 'PURCHASE_ORDER'
    @EndUserText.label: 'Appllication Type'
    @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition:                    // Annotation to link parameter with CDS view which will help to generate Text
    [ {
        entity: { name: 'ZCDS_ZDCP_FP_PDF_FORM',
    // entity: { name: 'I_OutputControlApplObjectType',
                  element: 'OutputControlApplObjectType'}
      }]
    p1_iv_object_type : apoc_appl_object_type,
    @Consumption.defaultValue : '001'

    @EndUserText.label: 'PDF Version(001(SAP),002(Custom)..etc'
    p2_iv_version_nr  : /accgo/e_ovd_version,
    //@Environment.systemField: #SYSTEM_DATE
    @Consumption.defaultValue : '2025'    
    @EndUserText.label: 'Fiscal year'
    
    p3_iv_fyear       : /accgo/e_fiscal_year,
    @Consumption.defaultValue : '1730'
    @EndUserText.label: 'Company Code'
    
    p4_iv_cc          : /accgo/e_companycode_vh


  as select from    I_OutputControlApplObjectType as objtype
  //association [0..1] to I_OutputControlApplObjectType as _ObjType on $projection.iv_object_type = _ObjType.OutputControlApplObjectType
    left outer join zdcp_fp_pdf_form              as pdfform on objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType = pdfform.iv_object_type
  //    left outer join ZCDS_ZDCP_FP_PDF_FORM              as pdfform on objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType = pdfform.iv_object_type
    left outer join ekko                          as po      on objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType = 'PURCHASE_ORDER'
    left outer join vbrk                          as bill    on objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT'
  // association [0..1] to I_OutputControlApplObjectType as _ObjType on $projection.iv_object_type = _ObjType.OutputControlApplObjectType
{
      .lineItem: [ {
      position: 10
      } ]
      // .selectionField: [{position: 10 }]
      // @Consumption.filter.defaultValue: 'PURCHASE_ORDER'
      @EndUserText.label: 'Appllication Type'

      //   @ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_ObjType'
  key objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType as iv_object_type,
      .lineItem: [ {
      position: 20
      } ]
      .selectionField: [{position: 20 }]
      @EndUserText.label: 'Document Number'
  key
      case
      when objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType = 'PURCHASE_ORDER' then po.ebeln
      when objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT' then bill.vbeln
      else 'Under Construction'
      end                                 as iv_object_nr,
      .lineItem: [{ type: #WITH_URL , url: 'valueLink', position: 30}]
      @EndUserText.label: 'PDF'
      @ObjectModel.readOnly: true
      'Download PDF->|'                   as showPdf,
      case
           when objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType = 'PURCHASE_ORDER' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',pdfform.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',po.ebeln), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''', po.bukrs),''')/$value'))))))
            when objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT' then
      // concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType), concat(concat('IvVersionNr=','000'),concat(concat('IvObjectNr=',bill.vbeln), concat(concat('IV_FYEAR=','0000'),concat('IV_CC=', bill.bukrs))))))
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',pdfform.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',bill.vbeln), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''', bill.bukrs),''')/$value'))))))
           else ''
          end                             as valueLink
      //Associations
      // _ObjType
}
where
      objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType = $parameters.p1_iv_object_type
  and pdfform.iv_version_nr               = $parameters.p2_iv_version_nr

Step 5 - Create a Fiori APP based on the CDS View entity ZCDS_OBJECT_PDF_V3 by choosing the option "SAP Fiori generator" in the "New Project From Template"

Then Choose the following option

Then choose the appropriate system with the service ZCDS_OBJECT_PDF_V3_CDS, which was generated from the CDS View ZCDS_OBJECT_PDF_V3.

Then choose the following Main entity

Then enter the appropriate Project attributes

Clicking the FINISH button will create the FIORI Application, which you can test.

entry.title: Re: Error when binding list input in Approval Form (SAP B...
entry.content:
Hi, 

It is most likely a bug; I have encountered it myself too - it seems there is an issue with binding lists directly from process input parameters to any tiles. Workaround I used is creating custom variable of the same type as the input list with initial value set to list from input parameter.

If list has fields of complex types (structures,objects) remember to assign it additionaly inside the tile (approval form in your case).

 

Hope it helps,

Michal

entry.title: Automate Offer Letter Generation by using SAP BTP Process Automation
entry.content:
In this blog, I am going to show you that how to automate the generation of offer letter using SAP BTP Process Automation.
Overview of the Automation Process
This automation process involves opening a Word file template, replacing placeholders with the new joinee's details, saving the customized offer letter, and sending it via email to the respective candidate.

First of all, we should have a offer letter template saved as docx file in our desktop as below :





Create a new automation project
Log into SAP Build Lobby.
Click create -> Automated Process->Automation and click on next

Name your project ‚ÄòOfferLetterGenerator‚Äô.
Provide a short description  ‚ÄúBot to generate offer letter‚Äù.

Click on ‚ÄòReview‚Äô and then ‚ÄòCreate‚Äô.

Designing the Automation Bot
In the automation section, click create -> automation and give the agent version

name it ‚ÄòOffer Letter Generator‚Äô and add description as ‚Äò An automation which generates offer letter and send email to respective candidate‚Äô.


Click on create.

Click on setting option, go to dependencies and  click on add -> Add a business process project dependency, then add ‚Äòoutlook SDK‚Äô  and ‚Äòword SDK' ( as in this automation we are going to use WORD and OUTLOOK so it is necessary as it makes available the different activities related to that particular software in our activities section )

Similarly add word SDK.


The key input parameters for this automation are:

  • companyName
  • candidateName
  • canAddress
  • currentdate
  • post
  • technologyunit
  • city
  • salary
  • joiningDate
  • HrManagerName
  • hremail
  • HrPhoneNumber
  • senderemail
  • receiveremail

So go to Input/Output section and create those input parameters as like : -

Similarly add all other input parameters as well.

Now, Add these activities by drag & drop from the tools section : -
i) Open Word Instance
ii) Open Document(Word)
iii) Replace All(Word)
iv) Save As(Word)
v) Close Document (Word)
vi) Close Word Instance
vii) Open Outlook Instance
viii) Send Email (Outlook)
ix) Close Outlook Instance

In Open Document (Word) activity, in parameter section add the path of offer letter template in ‚ÄòdocumentPath‚Äô field.

 

And in 'replace all (word)' activity give the placeholder and value name in old string and new string section for each detail which is needed to be replaced ,
as like this:


Similarly do for all placeholders.

After that, in Save As (Word) activity set the filepath as ‚Äò "{Folderlocation}\\" + Step0.candidateName + "_Offer_Letter.docx" ‚Äô ( so that the new offer letter word file generated is saved as that respective candidate name).

 

Now go to Send Email (Outlook) activity, and add parameters as,
from -> senderemail
to -> receiveremail
Subject -> Letter of Joining
Body -> "Please find the offer letter attached and report to the assigned location on exact date."
In attachment section click on custom data and add string value as the file location as
 ‚Äò "{Folderlocation}\\" + Step0.candidateName + "_Offer_Letter.docx" ‚Äô


Finally, Run the automation and fill the details in input fields : -

then click on test and you will find that a word file of offer letter with candidate name created at the folder location and a mail is sent to respective receiver. 

Benefits of this automation: -

  • Automating the offer letter generation process significantly reduces the time required to create and send offer letters.
  • It minimizes the risk of human error, ensuring that all details are correctly filled in.
  • The use of a standardized template ensures that all offer letters maintain a consistent format and tone.

entry.title: Re: Incorrect time in time zone setting
entry.content:
Hi All,

You have to check time and time zone in OS (Windows, linux, ...) of the App server and Database server

In the above case, the database time is earlier by about 5 minutes (increasing time of database server can be done without App stopping, while decreasing time on database server require App stop then start again after time decrease)

Of course to change time or time zone it will depends on OS itself, in windows you can do from "control panel"   in linux you can do with "date" command. Also in SUSE linux specially you can use "yast"

entry.title: Future Proof Microsoft Outlook Integration for SAP Sales Cloud with Microsoft Graph
entry.content:
To keep your sales team operating at peak efficiency, the tools they use must be reliable and future-proof. That's why we made migrating your SAP Sales Cloud's Server-Side Groupware Integration to leverage modern Microsoft Graph APIs a simple but important step to take. This isn't just about maintaining continuity; it's about enhancing security, improving reliability, and aligning with Microsoft's direction. Let's explore how this straightforward update can protect your sales operations from disruption.

The 5-Step Migration Process from EWS to Graph API

Now for the practical part. The good news is that we have made this migration process manageable. The core strategy isn't about changing your existing setup in-place, but rather creating a new, correctly configured Organization within Groupware and then moving your users into it. This approach minimizes risk and ensures a clean, controlled transition. Here is the step-by-step process to migrate your users, just like our official documentation describes it:

Step 1: Log in and Navigate to Organizations

First, log in to your SAP Sales Cloud V2 system with administrative privileges. From the main dashboard, navigate to the Groupware settings by going to:

Settings > Groupware > Organizations

This is the central hub where you manage how different groups of users connect to their email servers.

Step 2: Create a New Organization

Click to create a new organization. This will serve as the new home for all users connecting via the Microsoft Graph API. Give it a clear, descriptive name (e.g., "Microsoft Graph Users" or "M365 Graph Sync") to avoid confusion, and then save it.

Step 3: Configure the Mailbox for Graph API

This is the most crucial step. Select the new organization you just created. Within its settings, find the Email Configuration tab. Here, you must change the Mailbox Access Type from the default or EWS setting to the required option for Microsoft Graph APIs. This tells SAP Sales Cloud to use the modern authentication and API methods for this specific organization.

Step 4: Move Users to the New Organization

With your new Graph API-enabled organization ready, it's time to move the users over from the old EWS-based organization. SAP provides two flexible methods for this:

  • Bulk Move: Navigate to the main Users List in the Groupware section. From here, you can select multiple (or all) users at once and move them to the new organization. This is the most efficient method for migrating everyone.

  • Individual Move: If you prefer a phased rollout or need to move specific users one by one, you can go into each user's User Details Page and reassign them to the new organization individually.

Step 5: Verify and Decommission

Once users have been moved, their groupware sync will begin using the new Microsoft Graph API connection. It is highly recommended to test with a pilot user or group to confirm that emails, appointments, and contacts are synchronizing correctly. After you have successfully migrated all users and confirmed functionality, you can safely decommission the old EWS-based organization to complete the process.

Finalizing the Switch: The Key to Unlocking the Benefits

By following these steps, you're not just performing a technical update; you're actively future-proofing your sales team's most critical integration. However, remember there is one final, user-driven step to lock in these benefits. The migration is only finalized once each user re-authenticates their connection.

After being moved to the new organization, each user must navigate to Groupware User Settings > My Sync Status > Email Configuration and update their settings. This action will trigger a one-time consent request from Microsoft. Once they grant consent, their synchronization will officially and permanently switch to the more secure, reliable, and modern Microsoft Graph API. This final handshake ensures every member of your team is transitioned smoothly, securing your data flow and delivering the seamless operational continuity that is vital for sales success.

entry.title: General Task List Approval Process
entry.content:
Hello,

I need help with a specific topic. A customer wants to implement an approval process for general task lists.

They do not want the process to proceed when a general task list is created or changed without manager approval.

The idea is to create a custom Z-table to store the information temporarily, and once approval is given, use the appropriate BAPI ‚Äî either EAM_TASKLIST_CREATE or EAM_TASKLIST_CHANGE depending on the task ‚Äî to proceed with the process in alignment with the approval flow.

However, my main issue is that some of these general task lists are linked to calibrations, and I couldn‚Äôt find a suitable BAPI for this part. Could you help me with this? Is there any BAPI available to handle MIC (Master Inspection Characteristic) linkage for Type A general task lists?

I considered using a BDC, but I‚Äôm not sure if a BAPI and BDC can be executed in sequence reliably. Also, this is not a one-time upload or update ‚Äî it‚Äôs an ongoing process. That‚Äôs why I don‚Äôt think BDC would be an effective solution, as it can easily fail if the data deviates even slightly from the expected format.

I would appreciate your support.

Best Regard

entry.title: ABAP unit test coverage not work for CONSTRUCTOR
entry.content:
There is some logic in CONSTRUTOR method of my class, So I wrote some unit test for creating instance

1. The unit tests all passed successful, no dump

2. Debugging for the UT can run into break-point of CONSTRUCTOR method.

3. Other instance method UT coverage works good.

the problem is , the UT coverage of CONSTRUTOR method always 0%, anyone met this problem?

UT code like:

CLASS ltd_test DEFINITION FOR TESTING
  DURATION SHORT
  RISK LEVEL HARMLESS
  INHERITING FROM zcl_data.
  PRIVATE SECTION.

    DATA: mo_tool_double TYPE REF TO zif_data_tool.

    METHODS: setup

    METHODS: constructor_test FOR TESTING.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS ltd_test IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD setup.
    mo_tool_double ?= cl_abap_testdouble=>create( 'zif_data_tool' ).

  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD constructor_test .
    cl_abap_testdouble=>configure_call( mo_tool_double )->ignore_all_parameters( )->and_expect( )->is_called_once( ).
    mo_tool_double->get_data(  ).

    DATA lo_c TYPE REF TO zcl_data.

    CREATE OBJECT lo_c 
          EXPORTING io_double = mo_tool_double.


    cl_abap_testdouble=>verify_expectations( mo_tool_double ).
  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

entry.title: Re: Digital Signature reporting in SolDoc
entry.content:
There is no such report and no new development for that. Since solution manager will reach end of mainstream maintenance in 2027. (See SAPnote:3255311) In line with this decision, we are focusing on maintaining the stability and reliability of the current version rather than introducing new features.

Maybe you can go to the List View and display only Documents and filter with the status after the first signature was done and the document type. At least in that way you can see a list of the documents which need to be signed, although you cannot see if one specific person has to sign.

But as it is a legal obligation, I think there are some workarounds.

Have you some information or feedback about that?

Yours sincerely,

Teddy.

#COE#RFL01

Dear CustomerÔºå

 

Thanks for your patience.

"Number of Users" metric under HM indicates the Total number of currently active user sessions in the system.

I'm checked internally for the "UserType" info under Health Monitoring:

  • Dialog‚ÜíGUI in AL08
  • RFC‚ÜíRFC in AL08
  • CONCUR‚Üí user count after remove the duplicates. 
    This should not be calculated to the "Number of Users". see details under KBA 3522884 



Please feel free to let me know when further inquiries.

 

Best Regards,

Sunny

entry.title: BoE ‚Äì AP: Why Can‚Äôt We Set Maturity Date per Supplier Master ?
entry.content:
Dear expert, 

I‚Äôm reaching out to seek clarification regarding the handling of Bills of Exchange (BoE) due dates (maturity dates) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition).

Based on our testing and the SAP Knowledge Base Article [2837406 ‚Äì Due Date in Manage Automatic Payments for BOE Outgoing Payments], we understand that the BoE due date can either be manually entered during the automatic payment run or derived from the invoice due date, depending on the configuration setup shown in the KBA above. 

However, in our case, BoE maturity terms (e.g., 45, 60, or 90 days) are typically defined in individual supplier contracts and therefore differ from one vendor to another. As these terms are vendor-specific and contractually agreed, it would be both practical and efficient to maintain the BoE maturity term directly within the supplier master data. Doing so would enable the system to automatically apply the correct maturity during BoE processing, ensuring consistency and minimizing manual input.

Therefore, I would like to understand why SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition) does not currently support storing BoE maturity terms per supplier in the supplier master.

I kindly request your support in addressing the following:

  • Could you clarify why the system does not allow BoE maturity terms (e.g., 60 days) to be maintained per supplier?

  • Are there any planned enhancements in this area, or possible workarounds (such as using custom fields or extensibility features)?

  • What are the recommended best practices for handling BoE AP in scenarios where maturity terms are supplier-specific?

Your guidance on this matter would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,
HY

entry.title: Re: CCM: Block condition contract after final settlement...
entry.content:
With Status Profile, you can achieve this.
Go to SPRO > Logistics - General > Settlement Management > Condition Contract Management > Condition Contract Maintenance > Define Condition Contract Types.  Assign a Status Profile that includes a status like ‚ÄúFinal Settled‚Äù or ‚ÄúLocked‚Äù. Configure the status to restrict further processing (e.g., prevent changes or new settlements)

entry.title: SAC Advanced Formula Iterative Prioritization
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I need some suggestion and perspective advise on below calculation logic.

We have some car plate codes ( VLK_PRJ ) and each plate code has relavant customer code assigned in its masterdata as well as contract starting date. As the first step, I generate mapping combination with VLK_PRJ, Date ( Contract starting date ), and relavant customer code ( VLK_CUS ) and entrytype ( VLK_ETYPE ) as I_MAPPING which means mapping coming from integration.

Then, those values are shown to users, and they might enter some adjustments for customer assignments ( assuming the car will be given service to another customer in the future ). I keep those entries with entrytype A_MAPPING ( adjusted mapping ).

What I want to achieve is creating C_MAPPING records ( calculated mapping ) starting from the contract starting date until the end of planning date coming from version attribute. For this calculation I have below rules. Also, I have 21 customer in masterdata, and around 450 plate codes.

  1. If both A_MAPPING and I_MAPPING exists with the same combination of VLK_PRJ and Date, then I_MAPPING is ignored.
  2. If multiple combinations are entered for the same combination of VLK_PRJ and date, then the first customer code will be used, rest will not be considered. ( I know this might be handled from input screen, but let's assume user entered multiple combination by mistake )
  3. If there is no mapping entry for the further periods ( I_MAPPING only exists for the starting date, and no A_MAPPING is entered for the next period ), then duplicate it from preivous period as it is.

Please find below script which works as expected but it takes more than 3 mins which is too long I believe. I have 3 blocks of calculations, improvements or different approach for any part is appreciated.

CONFIG.GENERATE_UNBOOKED_DATA = OFF

MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "SDATA"
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/START] TO [d/Version].[p/END]
MEMBERSET [d/VLK_ETYPE] = ("A_MAPPING", "C_MAPPING", "I_MAPPING")
MEMBERSET [d/VLK_PRJ] = BASEMEMBER([d/VLK_PRJ], "PLAKA_AKTIF")

AGGREGATE_DIMENSIONS = [d/VLK_DET], [d/VLK_PCTR]
AGGREGATE_WRITETO [d/VLK_DET] = "#"
AGGREGATE_WRITETO [d/VLK_PCTR] = "#"

VARIABLEMEMBER #MAPPING_FLAG OF [d/VLK_ETYPE]

INTEGER @LV_CHECK
INTEGER @LV_COUNTER
INTEGER @i
INTEGER @LV_PREV_MONTH

DELETE([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING") //clear previously calculated mapping

IF [d/VLK_ETYPE] = "A_MAPPING" THEN //mapping adjustments
	FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_PRJ], [d/Date]
		FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_CUS] ASC
			DATA([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING") = RESULTLOOKUP() //only apply the first customer if multiple adjustments are entered for the same project time combination
			BREAK //do not proceed further
		ENDFOR
	ENDFOR

ENDIF

IF [d/VLK_ETYPE] = "I_MAPPING" THEN // mapping values coming from integration
	FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_PRJ], [d/Date]

		@LV_CHECK = 0 // not sure if necessary ?
		@LV_CHECK = RESULTLOOKUP([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "A_MAPPING") // check if there is an adjustment entry
		IF @LV_CHECK = 0 THEN // if there is no adjustment entry
			DATA([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING") = RESULTLOOKUP() // get whatever is coming from integration ( only 1 customer mapping is coming already from integration )
		ENDIF
	ENDFOR
ENDIF

IF [d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING" THEN // output mapping entrytype
	FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_PRJ], [d/Date] ASC //start from the first month of mapping entry of the project
		
		// if no mapping is processed before, process further.
		IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/VLK_ETYPE] = #MAPPING_FLAG, [d/Date] = "000000", [d/VLK_CUS] = "#") = NULL THEN 
			DATA([d/VLK_ETYPE] = #MAPPING_FLAG, [d/Date] = "000000", [d/VLK_CUS] = "#") = 1 // flag mapping as processed for the project

			@LV_COUNTER = DATEDIFF([d/Date], [d/Version].[p/END], "MONTH")
			IF @LV_COUNTER > 0 THEN //check if not at the last month already
				FOR @I = 1 TO @LV_COUNTER  // start from the next month
					@LV_CHECK = 0 // not sure if necessary ?
					@LV_CHECK = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = NEXT(@I, "MONTH", [d/Date])) // check if there is mapping entry for the next month
					IF @LV_CHECK = 0 THEN //if there is no mapping for the next month, get it from previous month
						
						@LV_PREV_MONTH = @I - 1
						DATA([d/Date] = NEXT(@I, "MONTH", [d/Date])) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = NEXT(@LV_PREV_MONTH, "MONTH", [d/Date]))

					ENDIF
				ENDFOR
			ENDIF
		ENDIF
	ENDFOR
ENDIF

Thanks,

Volkan

entry.title: Re: How can we know the number of customer invoices sent...
entry.content:
You need to develop a custom report considering tables like VBRK, NAST, ADR6 & VBPA.


Filter logic should be based on

  1. the Partner Function to ZM in VBPA
  2. billing date from VBRK for the specific year
  3. email address from ADR6 table
  4. Output type (ex.medium = 5 for email) and Status = Successfully processed from NAST.  The status would be helpful to exclude failed emails
